docs.abstract: President Trump and the Democratic presidential hopeful Michael R. Bloomberg exchanged sharp words on Twitter.
docs.snippet: President Trump and the Democratic presidential hopeful Michael R. Bloomberg exchanged sharp words on Twitter.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump and Michael R. Bloomberg, the former mayor of New York City, have been slinging insults at each other for weeks, but their Twitter war reached a new level on Thursday.

headline.main: ‘Mass of Dead Energy’ vs. ‘Barking Clown’: Trump and Bloomberg Swap Insults

docs.abstract: The formal notification to Congress prompted bipartisan outcry and accusations that the administration had again overstepped its constitutional authority.
docs.snippet: The formal notification to Congress prompted bipartisan outcry and accusations that the administration had again overstepped its constitutional authority.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Pentagon plans to divert $3.8 billion intended for military equipment to the construction of a wall at the southwestern border, it informed lawmakers on Thursday, drawing bipartisan outrage and reviving a long-running battle with Congress over funding for President Trump’s signature campaign promise.

headline.main: Administration to Divert Billions From Pentagon to Fund Border Wall
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Tells Congress It Will Divert $3.8 Billion to Fund Southern Border Wall

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: The suggestion that Lt. Col. Alexander S. Vindman should now face punishment by the Pentagon was one sign of how determined the president is to even the scales after his impeachment.
docs.snippet: The suggestion that Lt. Col. Alexander S. Vindman should now face punishment by the Pentagon was one sign of how determined the president is to even the scales after his impeachment.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As far as President Trump is concerned, banishing Lt. Col. Alexander S. Vindman from the White House and exiling him back to the Pentagon was not enough. If he had his way, the commander in chief made clear on Tuesday, the Defense Department would now take action against the colonel, too.

headline.main: Trump’s War Against ‘the Deep State’ Enters a New Stage
headline.print_headline: Alarm in Capital as Axes Swing In Growing Post-Acquittal Purge

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry

docs.abstract: President Trump had a busy morning on Twitter and the radio, in a tirade that rivaled his most grievance-filled moments since becoming president.
docs.snippet: President Trump had a busy morning on Twitter and the radio, in a tirade that rivaled his most grievance-filled moments since becoming president.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump made a number of staff moves on Thursday to ensure he will be surrounded by a cadre of loyalists at the White House even as he raged against an ever-growing cast of perceived enemies that included his former chief of staff, an impeachment witness, a juror he accused of bias and a Democratic rival.

headline.main: Trump Places Loyalists in Key Jobs Inside the White House While Raging Against Enemies Outside
headline.print_headline: White House Staff Moves  Place Premium on Loyalty

byline.original: By Michael D. Shear and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: Facing a barrage of criticism from the president about the Justice Department, the attorney general offered a rebuttal on Thursday.
docs.snippet: Facing a barrage of criticism from the president about the Justice Department, the attorney general offered a rebuttal on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Attorney General William P. Barr delivered a sharp reproach on Thursday to President Trump, defending the role of the Justice Department in the face of the president’s persistent attacks.

headline.main: Key Excerpts From Barr’s Interview With ABC

docs.abstract: The president dismissed criticism that the Justice Department had acted inappropriately in overruling the recommendation of its own prosecutors in the case of his longtime friend.
docs.snippet: The president dismissed criticism that the Justice Department had acted inappropriately in overruling the recommendation of its own prosecutors in the case of his longtime friend.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump congratulated Attorney General William P. Barr on Wednesday for intervening to lower the Justice Department’s sentencing recommendation for the president’s longtime friend Roger J. Stone Jr., calling his prosecution “a disgrace” for which he deserves an apology.

headline.main: Trump Praises Barr for Rejecting Punishment Recommended for Stone
headline.print_headline: Dismissing Criticism, President Says Prosecutors ‘Ought to Apologize’ to Stone

byline.original: By Eileen Sullivan and Michael D. Shear

docs.abstract: The former New York City mayor claimed to have “inherited” the policing policy and cherry-picked data to claim a 95 percent reduction.
docs.snippet: The former New York City mayor claimed to have “inherited” the policing policy and cherry-picked data to claim a 95 percent reduction.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael R. Bloomberg, the mayor of New York City from 2002 to 2013 and now a Democratic presidential candidate, sought on Tuesday to explain comments he made in 2015 aggressively defending the policing tactic known as stop-and-frisk. Here’s a fact check of his statement.

headline.main: Responding to Critics, Bloomberg Omits Role in Expanding Stop-and-Frisk
headline.print_headline: Expanding a Policy Before Curtailing It

docs.abstract: President Trump, barring the unforeseen, will be the first American president to face voters after being charged with high crimes and misdemeanors.
docs.snippet: President Trump, barring the unforeseen, will be the first American president to face voters after being charged with high crimes and misdemeanors.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump sat forward on the edge of his chair and chatted at length with reporters in the Oval Office on Thursday, unbowed but for him a little subdued. The day after he was impeached for high crimes and misdemeanors, he dismissed the judgment of the House of Representatives and punched back by celebrating with a Democratic congressman who switched parties to stand with him.

headline.main: After Impeachment, an Angry Trump Looks to Voters for Vindication
headline.print_headline: Under Cloud, Trump Is Still Unyielding

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry

byline.original: By Peter Baker, Maggie Haberman, Jeremy W. Peters and Elaina Plott

docs.abstract: Khalifa Hifter’s Virginia properties could make him vulnerable to a new lawsuit filed under a 1991 anti-torture law.
docs.snippet: Khalifa Hifter’s Virginia properties could make him vulnerable to a new lawsuit filed under a 1991 anti-torture law.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A former C.I.A. asset who now controls the most potent military faction in Libya has been accused of torturing Libyans, and some of them tried on Tuesday to use the American court system to fight back.

headline.main: Ex-C.I.A. Asset, Now a Libyan Strongman, Faces Torture Accusations
headline.print_headline: Libyans Seek Restitution In U.S. Court For Torture

docs.abstract: Accepting an award at Georgetown University, Ms. Yovanovitch, who was a key player in President Trump’s impeachment proceedings, spoke publicly for the first time since her testimony.
docs.snippet: Accepting an award at Georgetown University, Ms. Yovanovitch, who was a key player in President Trump’s impeachment proceedings, spoke publicly for the first time since her testimony.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Marie L. Yovanovitch, the former ambassador to Ukraine who became a central witness in the impeachment inquiry against President Trump, delivered a candid and at times stark assessment Wednesday of the declining health of American diplomacy.

headline.main: Marie Yovanovitch, Ex-Envoy, Offers Sober Appraisal of U.S. Diplomacy
headline.print_headline: Ex-Envoy’s Stark View  Of American Diplomacy

keywords.value: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
